programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Pursuit and Youths: The interceptors' skills are put to the test as they go in hot pursuit of tearaway teens and reckless youths. Jacko is on the hunt for a wanted teenager after he disappears in a housing estate and the interceptors are also hot on the heels of a stolen silver Micra
S13E02

programme.title: The Last Hunt (1956)
programme.desc: Cruel and bloodthirsty buffalo hunter Charlie Gilson comes into conflict with his world-weary companion Sandy. The tension between them comes to a head when Gilson kills a group of Native Americans and takes one of the women captive, prompting Sandy to step in and protect her. Western, starring Robert Taylor, Stewart Granger and Debra Paget

programme.title: The Stalking Moon (1968)

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Rookie recovery op Joe has a challenge when a delivery van slides off the road, ending up precariously balanced on the verge between a farm track and a muddy field

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Officers close in on a suspected stolen car near Tadcaster, but they have to deploy two stingers as the driver tries to escape by hitting speeds in excess of 100mph. On the outskirts of Harrogate, a car with suspected links to supplying drugs is pulled over, with a search yielding narcotics with an estimated street value of over £12,000
S06E15

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
After Dark: In this special edition, Ortis Deley and Rick Edwards join police using cutting-edge technology to crack down on crime, including tiny thermal-imaging cameras, handheld fingerprint sensors and tracking drones. Ortis joins Cheshire interceptors on a thrilling motorway pursuit, while Rick and the team tackle a drug driver and officers discover a massive cannabis farm
S13E05

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Andy Doran pulls over a driver for using his mobile phone behind the wheel and the situation escalates when the driver continues to avoid Andy's questions. On the M53, PC Chris Swash pulls over a car that is being driven at over 90mph and detects a strong smell of cannabis, so performs a drug test, while PC Amy Hollis is called to the scene of a two-vehicle collision near Cheshire Oaks
S02E08

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Young and Reckless: Cameras follow elite teams from the Durham and Cleveland forces as they tackle young, reckless drivers who cause carnage on the roads and put themselves and others in danger. Spike and dog handler Ian pursue a 20-year-old drunk driver who tries to lose them on a travellers' site, Ben goes head to head with a speeding boy racer, and Spike switches four wheels for two as he gets on his bike to catch illegal off-roaders tearing it up on the beach
S13E06

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S06E02

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc:
Gloucestershire police are called to a late-night break-in at a shop, where thieves targeting cigarettes have raided the premises and made off at high speed. On the M5, a traffic officer has to cope with torrential rain when he is called to a crash in the fast lane that has brought traffic to a standstill
S02E06

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Cameras capture wildfires as they ravage California, a tornado terrorising people trapped in a petrol station and daredevils skydiving over Antarctica
S03E11

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc:
Russell battles waterlogged tracks in the desert as he tries to deliver his load on time, and Yogi's reputation hangs in the balance following the biggest week of his career
S02E09

programme.title: Outback Truckers

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis goes out onto the city streets with police forces in Chester, Coventry, Rotherham and London. He reveals how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals who target shops and retail outlets to justice, including the 2011 London rioters

programme.title: The Rounders (1965)
programme.desc: Two modern-day cowboys are always on the lookout for a way to get rich, but their plans never seem to work out. When they are tricked into taking ownership of a horse that refuses to accept any rider, they see a chance to make a fortune by betting rodeo riders they cannot break in the animal. Comedy Western, starring Henry Fonda, Glenn Ford, Sue Ann Langdon, Hope Holiday and Chill Wills

programme.desc:
An arrest snowballs into a firearms stand-off for Damo, while Spike uncovers a stash of cannabis stored with shotguns and police dog Ronnie lands right on top of a wanted man. Ben chases a runaway driver, and Paul catches a hit-and-run culprit, who then kicks off in his car

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The pursuit of a white van tearing up the turf in Willington proves to be a family affair, while two-year-old German shepherd cross Titan earns his spurs, and Paul is sent on a roundabout hunt for a drunk driver. And Sam discusses police policy with a disqualified driver who will not accept he's in the wrong
S13E08

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Near Scarborough, there's a force-wide hunt for a group of dangerous and violent thieves on the run. As officers give chase to two stolen vehicles, their lives are put at risk as their cars are rammed and damaged by the thieves desperate to get away. In York, as the pubs and clubs kick out, a routine stop of riders on electric scooters suspected of drink driving leads to confrontation and difficult arrests
S12E16

programme.desc: Maverick cop 'Dirty' Harry Callahan is unwillingly teamed up with a female partner as he takes on terrorists who have stolen a shipment of weapons and explosives and plan to hold the city of San Francisco to ransom. programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Street Crime UK: Caught on Camera: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces across the UK to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to fight the huge rise in street crime. In London, the Met's robbery squads work the streets on a busy Friday night, and with criminals now using motorbikes to get away, cameras help officers identify, track and apprehend offenders. Nick also finds out how pickpockets, scammers and bag thieves use sleight of hand and distraction to relieve people of their valuables
S01E03

programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc:
Dentist Rhona Eskander discusses the red flags in teeth whitening scams and the team talk about the diabetes drug people are using for weight loss. Housing campaigner holds landlords to account for problems such as mould, damp, infestation and neglect and Dr Xand investigates the most common myths around sleep. Plus the largest maternity scandal in the history of the NHS that started with one grieving mother and ended up involving 1,486 families
S01E07

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Episode 6 (Shortened): A crew rushes to an amateur footballer who has suffered a serious and painful double fracture to his lower leg, battling torrential rain to ease the pain and stabilise his injury. In Edinburgh, a woman is found unconscious in a stairwell

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
In Bath, Somerset, Martin looks around a Grade II listed one bedroom flat that is up for auction before heading to Stoke on Trent to see a two bed terrace. Martel is in Featherstone, West Yorkshire looking around a pair of terraced houses that have been split into four flats
S26E17

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Leominster: Christina Trevanion is in Leominster in Herefordshire, where she learns about the history of the local hat and glove industries. Kate Bliss and Ochucko Ojiri are helping the teams
S58E27

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Special Interests: Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands surgery, following the personal and professional lives of a group of GPs
S24E52

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
Single mother Hayley and daughter Rosie Bell live in a former council house with virtually no storage room. The team hopes to reclaim the empty wall space and find a way to upcycle a piece of furniture that gives mum and daughter a place to eat together
S01E09

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Norfolk: Ginny Buckley helps a couple from Bedfordshire who are looking for a character property in Norfolk with a good-sized garden for some new canine companions, all on their budget of £450,000. Ginny also heads to Great Yarmouth, where she straps in for a white-knuckle ride on one of the country's last remaining wooden rollercoasters
S21E19

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers welcomes four more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to five professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. Here, the dealers are offered to chance to bid on a vintage stereoscope, two gigantic apothecary glasses and a children's game thought to be from the 19th century
S02E04

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S03E17

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Martin comforts Zack and implores him to look to his future with Whitney. Denise advises Kim to do whatever it takes to make amends with Howie, and an excited Billy is left devastated when Lola is forced to tell him the truth

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc:
Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr: The two finalists are challenged to make over two pubs in a busy tourist hotspot in Brighton. One designer will be transforming an award-winning gastro pub with a field to fork ethos, while the other competitor is tasked with turning a traditional pub into a fun day-to-night venue aimed at a younger clientele. Once the challenge is compete, the pair head back to the design studio where they are cross examined by Alan and the judges. Who will be crowned this year's winner?
S04E08

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
Nine home cooks take part in the audition round. Cooking their Family Favourite Dish, the hopefuls must show John Torode and Gregg Wallace who they are as a cook. The judges pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks immunity from cooking in the next round. However, for the remaining six contestants, they must cook a dish - sweet or savoury - good enough to get them in to the competition
S19E07

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc:
Didion Hell: Selby, Costello and Iris all seem to be thriving their new home, until disappointing news disrupts their dreams of a truly conventional family life. As Selby and Costello's relationship begins to sour, cracks in their family unit start to form and their seemingly perfect world begins to deteriorate, with devastating results
S01E04

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc:
Games, Trains and Automobiles: Obie takes Aki and Max to his mum's house and learns more than he bargained for. Kate, Jordan and Wendy attempt to conceal Gossip Girl's identity from a determined Mike
S02E05

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc:
How to Bury a Millionaire: Someone from the school's past returns with a proposal for Gossip Girl and a familiar figure blackmails Kate into ruining an important event

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc:
The team investigates long covid and the scammers cashing in on it with the help of consultant Joanna Herman who suffers from it herself. Plus, an exploration into the dangerous side effects of some common acne medications. Dr Xand examines the latest social media trend in which people tape their mouths closed while asleep to help with breathing, snoring and bad breath

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Episode 7 (Shortened): Chloe and Fergie attend a man who has suffered a suspected stroke, while Liam and Siobhan respond to a concerned mum whose toddler has taken a tumble off a trampoline. In the ambulance control centre, handler Remi takes a surprising call from someone requesting a taxi for a drunk friend

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore properties about to be auctioned, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings. A former fisherman's cottage in Broadstairs in Kent is given a stunning transformation and there are dramatic changes in store for property in Forest Gate in south London and Wigan in Greater Manchester
S25E57

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Ardingly 6: David Harper and Raj Bisram help the teams look for items at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, while Natasha Raskin Sharp finds out about a collection of early photographs documenting a world tour in 1874
S56E07

programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Chelsea steps in to support the Brannings. Keanu talks to Zack about Ravi's dodgy dealings, but he warns him that he should not get involved. However, Ravi agrees to give him a trial run by taking in a suspicious delivery the next day

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child
S06E13

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets
S03E06

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Arsenal at Etihad Stadium and West Ham United v Liverpool at London Stadium. The clash between City and the Gunners was likely to have a major bearing on the destination of the title, while the struggling Hammers looked for three vital points against a Liverpool side that have found results hard to come by away from home. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion, Chelsea v Brentford, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace, Aston Villa v Fulham and Leeds United v Leicester City

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
It's all about innovation as Gordon invites the food and drink entrepreneurs to Oxford to replicate a sushi platter as demonstrated by a master of the craft. Who will listen and learn? He then asks them to embrace the world of cocktails and seltzers in a can, challenging them to come up with a brand that stands out on supermarket shelves. They launch their products at the world-famous Royal Henley Regatta, where undercover experts report back to Gordon on which ones are proving the most popular
S02E04

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World

To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

Mark Smith gets a rare chance to see medals awarded to participants in the Easter Rising in Dublin in 1916, while Fiona meets the Armagh Rhymers, a folk group who dress in wicker costumes and preserve the ancient tradition of storytelling known as mumming

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Arsenal at Etihad Stadium and West Ham United v Liverpool at London Stadium. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:

To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets
S03E06

Mark Smith gets a rare chance to see medals awarded to participants in the Easter Rising in Dublin in 1916, while Fiona meets the Armagh Rhymers, a folk group who dress in wicker costumes and preserve the ancient tradition of storytelling known as mumming
S44E13

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations

While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. programme.desc:

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World

For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. programme.desc:

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Mark Smith gets a rare chance to see medals awarded to participants in the Easter Rising in Dublin in 1916, while Fiona meets the Armagh Rhymers, a folk group who dress in wicker costumes and preserve the ancient tradition of storytelling known as mumming

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

The clash between City and the Gunners was likely to have a major bearing on the destination of the title, while the struggling Hammers looked for three vital points against a Liverpool side that have found results hard to come by away from home. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion, Chelsea v Brentford, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace, Aston Villa v Fulham and Leeds United v Leicester City

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
It's all about innovation as Gordon invites the food and drink entrepreneurs to Oxford to replicate a sushi platter as demonstrated by a master of the craft. Who will listen and learn? He then asks them to embrace the world of cocktails and seltzers in a can, challenging them to come up with a brand that stands out on supermarket shelves. They launch their products at the world-famous Royal Henley Regatta, where undercover experts report back to Gordon on which ones are proving the most popular

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:

To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.desc: A brave Polynesian teenager has been raised by her father to be the chief of her people, but longs to leave their island home for a life as an explorer. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: A World of Wonder: A compilation of some of the most spectacular footage from the series, capturing wildlife from around the world on film using the latest camera technology, and revealing how they adapt to overcome the challenges posed by living in jungles, mountains, deserts, islands, grasslands and cities

Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

Ulster Folk Museum 2: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ulster Folk Museum near Belfast, where finds include a collection of dolls with eyes that change colour, an early Louis Vuitton trunk, an unusual black opal, and a pair of vintage Guinness signs. Mark Smith gets a rare chance to see medals awarded to participants in the Easter Rising in Dublin in 1916, while Fiona meets the Armagh Rhymers, a folk group who dress in wicker costumes and preserve the ancient tradition of storytelling known as mumming
S44E13

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc:
Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

programme.desc:

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. programme.desc:

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Heather Dewar visits Tobermory, where she draws a colour portrait of Ciorstag Wilson, who recently moved back to her native Mull after spending years on the mainland
S05E01

programme.title: An Innocent Man - Sgeulachd Oscar Slater
programme.desc: A look at Glasgow's 'square mile of murder', beginning with an insight into the case of Oscar Slater, widely believed to be the greatest miscarriage of justice in Scottish history

programme.title: An Lot (The Croft)
programme.desc:
Mìosan a’ Gheamhraidh: First of a two-part update from Donald 'Sweeny' Macsween's croft in Ness, as he faces a the difficult winter months. Sweeny is frustrated at the prices crofters get for their wool, so he visits British Wool's depot in Ross-shire for answers. Always on the lookout for ways to diversify, he speaks to a couple of buffalo breeders at their farm in Moray
S06E01

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc:
Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis
S10E04

programme.title: Dàn
programme.desc:
Roddy John MacLeod reads the poem Òran Mòr MhicLeòid and talks about a time in history depicted in the poem when the old clan traditions placing importance on music were fading
S01E09

programme.title: Alleluia! (Spiritual Music & Verse)
programme.desc:
Maeve MacKinnon performs the hymn O Ghràidh nach Caill do Ghrèim gu Bràth and Norman Gillies explains the role faith plays in his life. Presented by Iain MacKinnon
S05E07

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Piano Greats at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of songs from the kings and queens of the keyboards, whose performances have captivated audiences over the decades across a selection of the BBC's best-loved music programmes. From piano pioneers like Little Richard, Nina Simone and Ray Charles, who showed the world that the new sounds of pop and rock didn't just revolve around guitars, right through to modern maestros like Elton John, Lady Gaga and Jools Holland

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ruben and Lewis have dreamt of having a place on the Formula 1 circuit since they were children. After discovering their passion through go-karting, the teenage drivers and their supportive fathers have teamed up in the hope that they can work together towards a spot on a professional race circuit in high-spec cars. here, the pair meet their hero Lewis Hamilton, getting invaluable advice about breaking into the sport and discussing the lack of diversity that holds so many back

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc:
Priyanka Chopra Jonas: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.
S01E03

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: In February 2022, a video emerged of a young Afghan woman screaming for help whilst her door was being kicked in by the Taliban. Little is known about what took place after - where was she taken and for what reason? Yalda Hakim travels to Afghanistan after gaining access to her and her family after they were released from prison and as they plot their escape from Afghanistan to Europe.

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: In this week's Talking Business, Aaron Heslehurst travels to Rabat to explore Morocco's push into big renewable energy projects. Morocco wants to be a net exporter of clean energy to its neighbours and Europe but it still sources 40% of its own electricity from imported coal. How realistic is Morocco's move towards net zero and how quickly can it achieve it.

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: Rajan Datar's in Malaga taking a look at some of the surveillance tech that's watching you on your holidays. programme.title: Extreme Conservation
programme.desc:
The Maldives: In Extreme Conservation, presenter Michaela Strachan travels the world meeting people battling the effects of climate change, who are intervening in extreme ways to save species or entire ecosystems. In this edition, Michaela is in the Maldives, which is facing an existential challenge from global warming - its picture-postcard sand islands are literally being washed from the map. Research teams from around the world have been invited in to work with local scientists to try to quickly develop solutions before it's too late, and she meets those behind some of the more ambitious projects. Coral reefs are key to protecting the islands from storms and surges, but as the oceans warm, they are being killed off by coral bleaching. Scientists in the Maldives are trying different techniques to resurrect the reefs, from the use of electricity to promote growth to the search for more resilient species. As tourism and the population of the Maldives continue to grow, more land is needed for develop
S01E02

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Jakarta to Bogor: Michael Portillo travels through Indonesia, starting out from the capital Jakarta and travelling south to the city of Bogor, where he admires its botanical gardens
S01E11

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: The Kimono: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress
S01E02

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 11 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the second sessions of two quarter-finals. Three-time champion Mark Williams was among the winners at this stage last year, claiming a hard-fought 13-11 victory over Mark Selby's second-round conqueror Yan Bingtao

programme.title: The Crucible: 40 Golden Snooker Years
programme.desc: Steve Davis goes back to the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield to celebrate 40 years of the world snooker championship, talking to some of the players forever ingrained in the sport's history. The venue has become the home of snooker since the championships moved there in 1977, helping to create memorable moments and scenes of drama that live on to this day. Featuring interviews with former champions Stephen Hendry and Dennis Taylor, six-time runner-up and fans' favourite Jimmy White, and celebrity snooker addicts Richard Osman and Stephen Fry

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: The story of two women who fell in love on Christmas Eve, 1944, in the Ravensbrück concentration camp - a relationship that was kept a secret for many years

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Griff Rhys Jones's project nears completion - until he learns there is trouble with the roofs of the mill and the cottage. George travels to one of the last working watermills in Wales to get ideas for the mill's interior
S02E04

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Colours of Life: Early Earth was the canvas for a vast new palette, with the diversity of human skin tones telling the story of how humanity spread and ultimately conquered the planet. Dr Helen Czerski explores the true masters of colour - which are often the smallest and most elusive - travelling to the mountains of Tennessee to witness the colourful mating display of fireflies, and revealing the marine creatures that can change the hue of their skin in order to hide from the world
S01E02

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: Monitor Me: Dr Kevin Fong explores the boom in apps and gadgets designed to help people monitor their health around the clock. He meets some of the pioneers of this revolution and visits a man who self-diagnosed a life-threatening disease from his own data, without going to the doctor
S50E02

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Jakarta to Bogor: Michael Portillo travels through Indonesia, starting out from the capital Jakarta and travelling south to the city of Bogor, where he admires its botanical gardens
S01E11

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: The Kimono: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress
S01E02

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Jakarta to Borobudur/Kutoarjo: Michael Portillo explores the largest island of the Indonesian archipelago, travelling through rainforests and paddy fields from the capital, Jakarta, to the volcanic region at the heart of Java's Central Province. He visits Java's most dangerous volcano, Mount Merapi, learns how to make noodles, and visits the Borobudur Temple, a Buddhist shrine that lay buried under a layer of volcanic ash for centuries
S01E12

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: Mingei Pottery: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln
S01E03

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 12 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the final frames of two quarter-finals. Four-time champion John Higgins prevailed by the narrowest of margins at this stage last year, winning 13-12 against Jack Lisowski

programme.title: Davis v Taylor: The '85 Black Ball Final
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a look back at the final of the 1985 World Snooker Championship between Dennis Taylor and Steve Davis. The match finished after midnight, but kept an estimated 18.5 million viewers engrossed until the title was decided on the final black of the 35th frame. With contributions from Barry McGuigan, Ted Lowe, Stephen Hendry and Barry Hearn

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc:
Michael is infatuated with Nell and begins to defy his father's dominance. Luke's star is rising, Sheila has met her match and Maggie heads for married life
S01E03

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc:
Sheila's wedding offers a last chance for Luke and Moran to be reconciled. For Moran's daughters, however, his decline reminds them they were never able to leave him. In a bid to help, they organise a family reunion. Drama, starring Tony Doyle, Ger Ryan, Susan Lynch and Anne-Marie Duff
S01E04

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
The day of the festival arrives, and the showman's wagon is revealed to the locals. Plus, Griff Rhys Jones reflects on George's first job as an architectural designer as work on the cottage and the mill is finally completed
S02E05

programme.title: The Crucible: 40 Golden Snooker Years
programme.desc: Steve Davis goes back to the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield to celebrate 40 years of the world snooker championship, talking to some of the players forever ingrained in the sport's history. Featuring interviews with former champions Stephen Hendry and Dennis Taylor, six-time runner-up and fans' favourite Jimmy White, and celebrity snooker addicts Richard Osman and Stephen Fry
