programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
The Trains That Time Forgot: Britain's Lost Railway Journeys: Andrew Martin investigates why named trains, once the pride of the railway companies that ran them, have now largely been confined to locomotive history. Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways
S15E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of day 13 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the opening session of the second semi-final. There was nothing between John Higgins and Ronnie O'Sullivan at the end of last year's corresponding session, as they went into Friday's play level at 4-4, but it was O'Sullivan who would eventually prevail and go on to win the title for the seventh time in his illustrious career

programme.title: Stan & Ollie (2018)
programme.desc: Biopic of Laurel and Hardy, focusing on the events of 1953 as the comedy duo try to re-ignite their film careers by embarking on a gruelling tour of British variety halls. As they set out on their demanding schedule, with their wives back home in the US, Stan is distracted by his attempts to pin down the producer of their proposed comeback film and Ollie tries to heal a rift caused by a perceived professional betrayal. The build-up of pressure starts to tarnish their precious partnership. Steve Coogan and John C Reilly star

programme.title: The Belles of St Trinian's (1954)
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls hope to get rich quick by betting on a racehorse belonging to a classmate's wealthy father. However, they first have to foil a gang of thieves planning to steal the animal and outwit an undercover policewoman sent to infiltrate the school disguised as a teacher. Comedy, starring Alastair Sim, Joyce Grenfell and George Cole

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new stepfather, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role

programme.title: Christo and Jeanne-Claude: Monumental Art
programme.desc: Documentary which charts the creation of world-renowned artist Christo's first public work of art in the UK, the Mastaba. In the summer of 2018, on the Serpentine in London's Hyde Park, Christo constructed the Mastaba from 7,506 painted oil barrels. The work was inspired by ancient Mesopotamian tombs and weighs six hundred tonnes. It is the latest work in a career spanning half a century and stretching across the world, and the programme looks back on Christo's career and a life spent making provocative works of art with his wife and partner Jeanne-Claude

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
The Trains That Time Forgot: Britain's Lost Railway Journeys: Andrew Martin investigates why named trains, once the pride of the railway companies that ran them, have now largely been confined to locomotive history. Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways
S15E01

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 04/08/1994: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from August 8, 1994, featuring music by Maxx, Level 42, Ce Ce Peniston, Status Quo, Rozalla, Whitesnake, PJ and Duncan, Youssou N'dour with Neneh Cherry and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 10/08/1994: Simon Mayo presents music by Brand New Heavies, Future Sound of London, Shampoo, DJ Miko, Joe Cocker, Carleen Anderson, Let Loose and Wet Wet Wet in an edition originally broadcast on August 10, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 25/04/1985: Mike Read and Gary Davies present the chart programme, first broadcast on April 25 1985, featuring Bronski Beat and Marc Almond, Phil Collins, New Model Army, DeBarge, Eurythmics, Freddie Mercury, David Grant and Jaki Graham and USA for Africa

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 28/04/1988: Gary Davies and Nicky Campbell introduce the edition from April 24, featuring Pat and Mick, James Brown, Fairground Attraction, Brenda Russell, the Primitives, Luther Vandross, Joyce Sims, Bananarama, Will Downing, S'Express and Scott Fitzgerald

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the third session of the opening semi-final. Mark Williams enjoyed his strongest session of his match against Judd Trump at this stage last year, winning six of eight frames to reduce his opponent's lead to 13-11 and receiving a standing ovation. However, it was ultimately 'the Juddernaut' who progressed to the final

programme.title: Totally 60s Psychedelic Rock at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of the genre from programmes such as Colour Me Pop, How It Is, Top of the Pops and Once More with Felix. Performers include Status Quo, the Incredible String Band, Donovan, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band, Julie Driscoll with Brian Auger and the Trinity, the Moody Blues, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Joe Cocker, the Move, Procol Harum, Cream, Jimi Hendrix and the Who

programme.title: Zappa (2020)
programme.desc: The first all-access documentary - years in the making - about Frank Zappa. It conveys the scope of his prodigious and varied creative output, and the breadth of his extraordinary personal and political life. The documentary team was granted exclusive access by Gail Zappa to a vast collection of Zappa's unreleased music, movies, incomplete projects, unseen interviews and unheard concert recordings. Much of these were deteriorating and in danger of being lost for ever

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 25/04/1985: Mike Read and Gary Davies present the chart programme, first broadcast on April 25 1985, featuring Bronski Beat and Marc Almond, Phil Collins, New Model Army, DeBarge, Eurythmics, Freddie Mercury, David Grant and Jaki Graham and USA for Africa

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 28/04/1988: Gary Davies and Nicky Campbell introduce the edition from April 24, featuring Pat and Mick, James Brown, Fairground Attraction, Brenda Russell, the Primitives, Luther Vandross, Joyce Sims, Bananarama, Will Downing, S'Express and Scott Fitzgerald

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 04/08/1994: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from August 8, 1994, featuring music by Maxx, Level 42, Ce Ce Peniston, Status Quo, Rozalla, Whitesnake, PJ and Duncan, Youssou N'dour with Neneh Cherry and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Destination Timbuktu: The former Monty Python star's expedition takes him to Senegal, where he witnesses a wrestling competition, visits jazz clubs, and meets soap star Marie-Madeleine. He also visits Bamako and Dogon country, then travels to Djenne, where he celebrates the Muslim Tabaski feast and secures a passage on a cargo boat to take him down the Niger River to Timbuktu
S01E02

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
North by Northwest: The intrepid traveller embarks on a trip from the Khyber Pass to the Bay of Bengal, an arduous journey through Pakistan's mountains, India, Nepal, China and finally Bangladesh. The adventure begins on the Khyber steam railway, taking in Darra, where he browses for a unique firearm. He then heads toward Chitral to watch a freestyle polo grudge-match take place on the highest polo field in the world
S01E01

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise tries to get closer to Jon, causing a jealous Alberte to challenge the profiler's cover story. Frederik discovers that one of Jon's old friends, who also owned Breidablik, perished in a mysterious fire. In Danish
S01E07

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise and Frederik put pressure on Jon to accept responsibility for his actions, but once again he takes advantage of his relationship with Alberte. Louise decides to confront the past. In Danish
S01E08

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
The Curse of the Claw: An adventurer sets out to return sacred relic the Claw of the Holy Vulture to Burma to stop its curse falling on his family. Vintage comedy, starring Michael Palin
S01E06

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Whinfrey's Last Case: A dashing British hero suffers a conflict of loyalties on learning of the German plan to start the First World War a year early - on the same day as his annual Cornish fishing holiday. He elects not to either sacrifice his much-needed break but soon runs into an even more dastardly plot. Comedy, starring Michael Palin
S02E01

programme.title: Peter Sellers: A State of Comic Ecstasy
programme.desc: The comedy pioneer behind The Goon Show, Dr Strangelove and the Pink Panther series is explored in depth in this film surveying his meteoric rise to fame and troubled personal life. The film charts his formative years backstage as part of his parents' itinerant music hall revue group, his years of wartime service in India and Burma, through to his global superstardom. His two surviving children Sarah and Victoria recall the challenges of growing up alongside his mood swings, while his grandson Will explores the troubled legacy his grandfather left behind

programme.title: Dawn Chorus: The Sounds of Spring
programme.desc: Filmed without voiceover or music, this programme highlights the call of the birds at sunrise, as those living within Britain's habitats burst into song and reveal the natural splendour of their distinctive chorus

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Destination Timbuktu: The former Monty Python star's expedition takes him to Senegal, where he witnesses a wrestling competition, visits jazz clubs, and meets soap star Marie-Madeleine. He also visits Bamako and Dogon country, then travels to Djenne, where he celebrates the Muslim Tabaski feast and secures a passage on a cargo boat to take him down the Niger River to Timbuktu
S01E02

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
North by Northwest: The intrepid traveller embarks on a trip from the Khyber Pass to the Bay of Bengal, an arduous journey through Pakistan's mountains, India, Nepal, China and finally Bangladesh. The adventure begins on the Khyber steam railway, taking in Darra, where he browses for a unique firearm. He then heads toward Chitral to watch a freestyle polo grudge-match take place on the highest polo field in the world
S01E01

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank heads for Mali to visit Dogon country, where he examines masks said to connect the land of the living with that of the dead, and admires ancient paintings

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: In a documentary originally broadcast in 1977, Sian Phillips introduces a Silver Jubilee year report on the contrary country west of Offa's Dyke, which is the pride of some of its inhabitants and the despair of many others

programme.title: Dance Passion Liverpool: Find the Feeling
programme.desc: A day in the life of the city through a series of dances, as soloists, choreographers and troupes - both amateur and professional - use pavements and landmarks as their stage, performing everything from high-energy Afrodance and beautiful ballet to energetic hopak and vibrant vogueing

programme.title: The Prince and the Composer
programme.desc: In a documentary first shown in 2011, the then Prince Charles profiles composer Hubert Parry, who is best known for the choral song Jerusalem and the well-loved hymn Dear Lord and Father of Mankind. With the help of Parry's family, as well as scholars and performers, the royal presenter explores the complex character behind the popular pieces of music

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Now an ambitious young man making a name for himself in London, David returns to Suffolk with his schoolfriend Steerpike in tow to catch up with Peggoty, his late mother's maid. Adaptation of the Dickens classic, starring Pauline Quirke and Ciaran McMenamin

programme.title: The Price of Everything (2018)
programme.desc: Documentary that explores the labyrinthine art world of the 21st century and examines both the place of art and artistic passion in a money-driven, consumer-based society. Featuring collectors, dealers, auctioneers and artists including Jeff Koons, Gerhard Richter and Njideka Akunyili Crosby and Larry Poons, the film exposes deep contradictions as it holds a mirror up to the values of the modern era, coaxing out the dynamics at play in pricing the priceless

programme.title: For Folk's Sake: Morris Dancing and Me
programme.desc: Richard Macer infiltrates morris dancing's endangered world of bells, beer and beards, discovering that women may be the unlikely saviours of this ancient masculine tradition

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: In a documentary originally broadcast in 1977, Sian Phillips introduces a Silver Jubilee year report on the contrary country west of Offa's Dyke, which is the pride of some of its inhabitants and the despair of many others

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Yogyakarta to Ambarawa: Michael Portillo travels to Java's Central Province and the royal city of Yogyakarta, where he visits the Sultan's Palace and admires the ancient art of shadow puppetry. Moving north to Ambawara, Michael boards a scenic heritage line constructed by the Dutch with carriages dating from the time of his Bradshaw's guidebook
S01E13

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Sheffield to Keadby: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair to his narrowboat the Naughty Lass while on the Tinsley lock flight in South Yorkshire. He then cruises beneath Conisbrough's magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal
S04E01

programme.title: Inside the Bat Cave
programme.desc: Lucy Cooke presents a documentary taking a journey into the secret world of one of the most endangered and least understood animals on Earth - bats. With cutting-edge night-vision cameras and ultrasonic detectors, this programme follows a greater horseshoe bat roost for four months, capturing the hidden life of the colony as never before, witnessing the birth of a new generation of pups and tracking their progress towards their perilous maiden flights outside the roost

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc:
Barcelona: An Art Lovers' Guide: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miró and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudí
S01E02

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to Margaret Atwood, who traces her writing back to sagas that she invented with her brother as a child. She recalls an opera about fabrics that she wrote and performed at high school for a home economics project, how she staged puppet shows for children's parties, and the huge impact that reading George Orwell had on her

programme.title: A Portrait of Carol Shields: Dressing Up for the Carnival
programme.desc: Documentary charting the distinguished career of the award-winning novelist and the long battle with cancer to which she succumbed in 2003 at the age of 68. Born in Chicago in 1957, Carol Shields settled in Canada and went on to raise five children and publish 16 novels, scooping the Pulitzer Prize for her book The Stone Diaries along the way. Interview footage with Carol, her daughters and a selection of her literary peers highlight the life of a gentle unassuming writer

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc:
A Woman's Place: Documentary examining the impact of novels from three perspectives - the empire, class experience and, in this first film, women's voices. The programme aims to show the plight of women is a theme that reaches right back to the earliest novels, with extracts from Jane Austen, the Brontes, Mary Shelley and Virginia Woolf, through to the post-war publishing boom where a new generation of global writers such as Zadie Smith, Toni Morrison, Arundhati Roy and Margaret Atwood have continued to speak out for women to a new generation of readers
S01E01

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Yogyakarta to Ambarawa: Michael Portillo travels to Java's Central Province and the royal city of Yogyakarta, where he visits the Sultan's Palace and admires the ancient art of shadow puppetry. Moving north to Ambawara, Michael boards a scenic heritage line constructed by the Dutch with carriages dating from the time of his Bradshaw's guidebook
S01E13

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Sheffield to Keadby: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair to his narrowboat the Naughty Lass while on the Tinsley lock flight in South Yorkshire. He then cruises beneath Conisbrough's magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal
S04E01

programme.title: Craftivism: Making a Difference
programme.desc: Writer, comedian and art lover Jenny Eclair meets people doing extraordinary things with knitting, cross-stitch, banners and felt to change hearts and minds across the world

programme.title: The Prince and the Composer
programme.desc: In a documentary first shown in 2011, the then Prince Charles profiles composer Hubert Parry, who is best known for the choral song Jerusalem and the well-loved hymn Dear Lord and Father of Mankind. With the help of Parry's family, as well as scholars and performers, the royal presenter explores the complex character behind the popular pieces of music

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ambarawa to Surabaya: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture
S01E14

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Keadby to Kiveton Park: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage
S04E02

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Why?: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench
S02E04

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Cold Feet: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam
S01E03

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Detailed account of the bloody uprising at a New York State prison in 1971. Over 1,000 inmates took control of Attica Correctional Facility, seizing 39 hostages in the process. Their demands related mainly to the inhumane conditions they were forced to endure, but a huge police assault and a hail of gunfire killed 29 convicts and 10 innocents, an action that has left many survivors, both guards and inmates, seeking compensation

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Beyond the Rainbow: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease
S01E03

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ambarawa to Surabaya: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture
S01E14

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Keadby to Kiveton Park: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage
S04E02

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 2/5: Fitness fanatic Jonny Thompson hosts the second night in Cumbria, where he hopes to wow his guests with a meaty menu - and they get to see a lot more of him than they had bargained for

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Three Cardiff couples compete to win £1,000 by throwing the perfect dinner part. First-time hosts Abi and Jake plan an American-themed menu. Their home-made fare impresses most of their guests, and their special effort for vegan couple Ashleigh and Jack is really appreciated. On night two, passionate vegans Ashleigh and Jack serve a fully plant-based menu designed to satisfy even the most committed meat eaters, but their rivals aren't convinced that they can be converted. On the final night, Karen and James are confident a more traditional menu will show the 'youngsters' how it's done
S2020E24

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: South Africa's Garden Route: Jerry and Christine Steele's love of South Africa began decades ago and they have decided to spend part of their retirement in a second home among the beaches and national parks of the Garden Route stretch of the south-eastern coast. For their budget of £60,000, Laura Hamilton shows them five great value properties.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Costa del Sol: Although she's approaching retirement age, Karmen Meredith is in no mood to slow down. Instead, the Derbyshire woman is looking for a bolthole on Spain's Costa del Sol, so Danni Menzies shows her five properties to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
A couple buy a B&B in Portugal at the height of the Covid lockdown, a family renovate a Norfolk cottage to fund a move to Italy, and there's a new glampsite in the making in France
S07E31

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more items to fix up and sell on, visiting the Isle of Wight to meet a couple who have lots of unwanted militaria in their sheds. While Henry embarks on an ambitious project to turn y tank parts into hanging baskets, Simon plans to transform old insulators into studio flat lighting
S05E01

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 1/5: Laetitia Kotsiopoulos hosts the first dinner party in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, where she hopes an evening of French gastronomy and a menu that includes snails, veal and a traditional cheese course will impress her guests and win her the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 2/5: Eva Philippou hosts the second night in Birmingham's Sutton Coldfield district, where she tries to impress her guests with a Greek feast, and hopes that dancing as her choice of entertainment will see her leading the field. However, rivals Laetitia and Sharon remain confident about their chances

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 3/5: In the Birmingham suburb of Sutton Coldfield, publican Randy Johnson wants to prove that he can put on more than mediocre pub grub, and tries to impress his guests with a black-tie theme and some interesting culinary techniques - including cooking with bricks. He surprises Sharon when he reveals that he used to sing in musicals, while Eva accidentally spits out a pistachio nut during one of her laughing fits

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 4/5: Lettings agent Sharon Wozniak hosts the fourth party in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, and she hopes to impress her guests with a classic West Midlands curry - but some diners are unimpressed by her menu. However, she manages to get French foodie Laetitia Kotsiopoulos to admit her wine was a good choice, despite being made locally. Later, her fish dish does not go down well with another contestant, so she hopes her deconstructed Margarita cheesecake can improve her chances of winning the prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 5/5: Outspoken hairdresser Patrick McMurray hosts the final party in Sutton Coldfield, and prepares a scallop starter and a classic beef Wellington. His first course goes down well, but Sharon soon becomes bored with his constant showing off - and it remains to be seen whether his saucy entertainment will prove a hit with the female guests

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Almuñécar: Marian and Donald seek a two-bed, two-bathroom property with a sea view in Almuñécar on Spain's Costa Tropical. Jasmine Harman jets off to help the pair by finding five options for them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Costa Blanca: Jacqui Lockhart has worked hard all her life, and now that she has the savings available she wants to fulfil her lifelong dream of owning a holiday home on Spain's southern Costa Blanca. With a cash budget of £50,000 and the support of her daughter Judy, the pressure is on for Danni Menzies to help Jacqui secure her dream property

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding are back with the charity version of the baking show, as TV presenter Emma Willis, radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, Taskmaster co-host Alex Horne and Inbetweeners actor Blake Harrison make their way to the tent. They take on three challenges - decorated biscuits, madeleines in the technical and a showstopping choux sculpture embodying their secret talent, with Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith passing judgement
S05E01

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the guest bedroom, with plans afoot to create a secret, Narnia-inspired room in the eaves, accessed through the bedroom wardrobe. The couple head to the local auction house in Wincanton, in search of the perfect pair of matching bedside tables. Sarah also wants to build a peaceful retreat in a corner of her garden. For inspiration, she takes Laurie to Taunton to see the Willow Cathedral, a unique living structure, to recreate back at home
S03E02

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
How Heavy Is the Water?: Kiell Smith-Bynoe finds himself playing bingo without any shoes on, Mae Martin plays an unusual but potentially brilliant drum solo and all the comedians create boats to carry eggs, in a race involving eggs in boats. Greg Davies hands out the scores, while Alex Horne hands out the tasks, designed to test the comedians' daring, dexterity and dignity under pressure - and to also make them look a little bit silly too
S15E04

programme.title: Derren Brown: Showman
programme.desc: This one-off special brings Derren Brown's record-breaking, five-star show to TV. Written by Derren Brown, Andrew O'Connor and Andy Nyman, the award-winning team behind Miracle, Svengali and Derren's BAFTA-winning Channel 4 specials, the critically acclaimed Showman is probably Derren's most personal show to date

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:
The hunters use social media in a sneaky bid to trap YouTube star Saffron Barker, so in their attempt to make it all the way to extraction, she and partner Bobby Seagull bare all. Nik and Eva Speakman head to Brighton for some deep cover at the home of former Coronation Street actor Brian Capron. In County Durham, Katya Jones and Aimee Fuller plan a rendezvous with Katya's former Strictly Come Dancing partner Ed Balls
S05E05

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: One-off special following South Yorkshire Police investigating reports of bullying, from playground brawls and racism in schools, to coercive domestic abuse. Cases featured include a 14-year-old boy hospitalised by a gang in the street, a single vulnerable woman being systematically targeted by local teens in her own home, and a distraught mother watching her 27-year-old son attempting suicide after being bullied at work

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc:
On the beat with the police officers who patrol the city of Brighton after dark. PC Jack gets called to a street assault, but finding out who is the suspect and who is the victim proves difficult. PCs Matt and Amelia find a bloody-handed youth on a bus after reports of a smashed window and PC Aj chases down a suspected house burglar
S01E06

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A rugby player is scanned for spinal damage following a collision during a match, and describes her struggles with mental health issues as she awaits the results. A teacher is knocked off his bicycle after receiving some bad news, while a man who broke two bones in his ankle after a fall is assisted by his dead wife's best friend
S24E07

programme.title: Work on the Wild Side
programme.desc: On the Eastern Cape, its rhino day for vet Emily as she needs to move three male rhinos to a new home. And at the Vervet Monkey Foundation, Josie meets new arrival, Dobby

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 3/5: Eccentric sheepdog trainer Katy Cropper hosts the third dinner party in Cumbria, where she prepares 'come a cropper' prawns al fresco, opens a bottle of Champagne with a Masai sword, and serves some potent home-made horseradish sauce. Aside from the food, a sheep-herding demonstration proves to be a hit with her guests

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Almeria, Spain: Nurses Philip Vaux and Alec Billen from Somerset have been dreaming about owning a place in Spain for 10 years. Having inherited some money when Alec's father died, they have decided to buy a holiday home in the beautiful province of Almería in south-east Spain, so call on Laura Hamilton for advice

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Lanzarote: Patrick and Corrine Duly from East Sussex first visited Lanzarote four years ago. They immediately fell in love with the island, and now that they've retired they're looking for a holiday home where they can escape to and spend more active winters in the sun. With a budget of £140,000, Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties in the south of the island

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In Cumbria, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit collector Paula, who badly needs some cash to fix her leaking roof. Henry picks a Morris Minor for restoration, while Simon turns some unwanted wood into furniture that seriously impresses independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan
S05E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 1/5: Children's food educator Beth Stephens hosts the first dinner party in Lowestoft, Suffolk, where she plans to impress her guests - caravan site owner Ray, beauty therapist Polly, housing officer Jonalt and ASBO officer Rachel - with locally sourced seasonal food. However, she and Rachel gang up on Ray for most of the evening

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 2/5: Caravan park owner Ray hosts the second night in Lowestoft, where he hopes to win the £1,000 prize with a Spanish-themed evening, complete with a homemade tropical zone and an Ibiza-style club night in a barn - despite it being the middle of winter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 3/5: Luxury-loving beautician Polly hosts the third evening in Lowestoft, Suffolk, and is determined to prove she is more than just a pretty face. She opts for a fine-dining menu that stresses quality over quantity, and hopes her smart dress code will bring out the genteel side of her guests - but distractions soon emerge in the form of revelations about Ray once being a new romantic

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 4/5: Albanian-born civil servant Jonalt hosts the fourth party of the competition in Lowestoft, Suffolk, and hopes his family recipes can impress his guests. He demonstrates a hidden talent that makes the diners laugh, and one contestant is left feeling the heat when Beth and Rachel unite

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 5/5: The final dinner party in Suffolk is hosted by anti-social behaviour officer Rachel, who hopes to win over her guests with an evening of comfort food and a few tricks up her sleeve. She hates to lose, but will need to curb her comments towards the other guests and let her dishes do the talking if she wants to be in with a chance of beating joint leaders Holly and Jonalt

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Villamartin, Costa Blanca: Lee and Louise from Warwickshire are looking for a three-bedroom, two-bathroom detached villa with a private pool in Villamartin on Spain's Costa Blanca, for their budget of £212,000. Leah Charles-King shows them five impressive properties, hoping at least one will be good enough to tempt Lee and Louise to make an offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Orihuela Costa, Spain: London couple Merwyn and Liesl Lobo are looking for a holiday home in Orihuela Costa in eastern Spain, so Danni Menzies shows them five properties for their £125,000 budget

programme.title: The Secret World of...
programme.desc:
The Secret World of Sweets: Jo Brand unwraps the nostalgic story of the world of sweets and lifts the lid on the biggest rivalries and innovations that have driven the sweet world. Jo unpacks the historic rivalry between Rowntree's and Bassett's before the cosy British sweet market gave way to a bitter battle after the arrival of Mars and Haribo, and key players from some of the industry's biggest brands reveal just how fierce the battle is to keep life sweet
S02E03

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding are back with the charity version of the baking show, as TV presenter Emma Willis, radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, Taskmaster co-host Alex Horne and Inbetweeners actor Blake Harrison make their way to the tent. They take on three challenges - decorated biscuits, madeleines in the technical and a showstopping choux sculpture embodying their secret talent, with Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith passing judgement
S05E01

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: One-off special following South Yorkshire Police investigating reports of bullying, from playground brawls and racism in schools, to coercive domestic abuse. Cases featured include a 14-year-old boy hospitalised by a gang in the street, a single vulnerable woman being systematically targeted by local teens in her own home, and a distraught mother watching her 27-year-old son attempting suicide after being bullied at work

programme.title: Good Boys (2019)
programme.desc: Three lads skip school and embark on an epic journey while carrying stolen drugs. They are hunted by teenage girls, and attempt to make their way home in time for a long-awaited party. Director Gene Stupnitsky's comedy, starring Jacob Tremblay, Keith L Williams and Brady Noon

programme.title: Derren Brown: Showman
programme.desc: This one-off special brings Derren Brown's record-breaking, five-star show to TV. Written by Derren Brown, Andrew O'Connor and Andy Nyman, the award-winning team behind Miracle, Svengali and Derren's BAFTA-winning Channel 4 specials, the critically acclaimed Showman is probably Derren's most personal show to date

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body
S11E02

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, critiquing The Outlaws, Family Fortunes, You, Celebrity Yorkshire Auction House and The Mating Game. They also offer their thoughts on ITV News of COP26 and other stories. Narrated by Craig Cash
S18E08

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A 69-year-old man is rushed to St George's after collapsing on a tennis court, and the resus team has to work quickly to get his dangerously high heart rate under control. Other patients include a father suffering from shortness of breath and a young man who sustained a head injury playing football. Newly qualified consultant Mehrad recounts what it's like to work under pressure and the satisfaction of saving a patient's life
S24E01

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 4/5: Holly Venning hosts the fourth dinner party from Cumbria and the food marketing manager wants to show her love for her home county through her menu. She prepares Cumbrian scallops and chorizo, followed by a traditional Cumberland sausage - but her Penrith fudge pudding doesn't appeal to everybody

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Fun-loving Karen and Irena kick-off the competition in Nottingham with a menu of comfort food. On day two, Lee and Maemae cook up an Indonesian menu with a British twist. Finally, it's Clayton and Nina's turn to up the ante with an evening of French fine dining
S2020E08

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Phuket, Thailand: Amanda and Adam Cropper have been visiting Phuket in Thailand on holiday for some time and love it so much they decided to get married on the island. Now they're looking for their very own property there, initially to use as a holiday home before they move out full-time in the next few years. Jonnie Irwin guides them through the local market and shows them five properties for their £160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Malaga: Martial arts experts Dan and Sally Ferretti from Bristol have travelled the world for competitions, but are now looking to relax. Despite never having been to southern Spain before, this adventurous couple have decided to buy their very own holiday home there, and have identified the mountains around Malaga as the perfect place. Danni Menzies is on hand to show them five great properties for their £80,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
A family of five begin searching for their dream home in Italy, and it's panic stations in France as the glampsite hosts prepare for their first guests
S07E33

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In Suffolk, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet former agony aunt Janet, whose garden shed is crammed with goodies. With no motors to unearth, Henry makes a rare furniture discovery, while Simon finds a vintage tram bench
S05E03

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 1/5: In the Manchester area, 27-year-old full-time mum Johanna, plans an evening dedicated to takeways from Turkey to China and India. Her guests are 34-year-old lorry driver Ryan, 48-year-old housewife Fiona, 45-year-old laundrette owner Linzi and 53-year-old translator Nico, on a night that includes a sojourn into Shakespeare

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 2/5: In Manchester, lorry-driving movie buff Ryan plans a film-inspired menu including his 'Prawn Identity' starter, 'Sausage Meat the Fockers' and 'Chocolate Clockwork Orange' desert. Unfortunately the first course is more of a disaster movie for Johanna, who has to face her fear of prawns. Meanwhile, Nico puts the cat among the pigeons with his views on male chefs and Fiona takes Linzi to task over her beauty regime

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 3/5: Glamorous 'domestic delegator' Fiona aims to impress with a classy but effortless menu as she hosts the third dinner party of the week in the Manchester area. However, critical Linzi takes issue with Fiona's mother chopping her vegetables and her cousin making her honeycomb. Then, there's more trouble brewing as Nico and Johanna clash

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 4/5: Critical laundrette owner Linzi has been a hard taskmaster all week in the Manchester area, so expects to show her guests where they've been going wrong. She's not pleased when Ryan questions her choice of starter. When the guests find out what Linzi does for a job, Nico struggles to understand the concept of a laundrette. Self-proclaimed domestic delegator Fiona has to face her fears during Linzi's entertainment - an ironing competition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 5/5: On the final night in the Manchester area, Nico plans to show the Brits how it's done in the kitchen with his Italian cooking. He's been talking up his Italian heritage all week, and Linzi's convinced he's heading for a fall. Ryan's shocked by some of Nico's locker-room tales, while baby of the group Johanna horrifies the other female contestants with her thoughts on gender politics. It remains to be seen who will pick up the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Dénia: Newlyweds Alison and Gabriel from Greater Manchester have been together for five years and are looking to buy a property together in the town of Dénia on Spain's northern Costa Blanca. Craig Rowe lines up five properties for them to consider, all within their budget of £110,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Murcia: Lea and her best friend Fiona are on the hunt for a second home in the Murcia region of Southern Spain, somewhere Lea feels will also help husband Peter's arthritis symptoms. Property expert Scarlette Douglas summons on her expertise to line up five options within the £90,000 budget

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Camden, 2012: Architect Henning Stummel and his partner Alice Dawson plan to convert a dilapidated joinery workshop in north London into a contemporary family home and office. They want to preserve the building's original steel frame, but to restore it they will have to take it down, which means carefully extracting it from the neighbours' walls without causing damage to their property - and that's just the start of the couple's problems. Kevin McCloud follows their progress
S12E08

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Brilliant Builds: Into the Garden: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows that highlighted the need to get the balance between home and garden just right. In Bury St Edmunds, Lauren Grant believes the opportunity to build on a land she and husband Christian bought from the council will transform their confused downstairs. He, however, just wants rid of the house altogether. Meanwhile, Harrogate couple Carol and Andrew need extra space for Grandad. Can Kirstie build into their sizeable garden or will Phil find somewhere else more suitable?
S01E06

programme.title: xXx (2002)
programme.desc: Extreme sports star Xander Cage finds himself in trouble when his daredevil exploits land him behind bars. However, he is offered an intriguing escape route, courtesy of National Security Agent Augustus Gibbons - who thinks the adrenaline junkie is the perfect man to bring down a gang of international terrorists in Prague. Action adventure, starring Vin Diesel, Samuel L Jackson, Asia Argento, Marton Csokas and Michael Roof

programme.desc:

S20E02

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc:

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 5/5: Estate agent Wendy Tinnion helms the final event in Cumbria and decides to throw a Friday night disco for her fellow diners. However, her guests are in for a shock when they discover something unexpected about their host

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In Nottingham, three rival couples compete to host the best dinner party and win £1,000. Ultra-competitive accountants Omer and Adeeba serve up an experimental Asian menu. Sustainable food growers Bobby and Alison, who live in a yurt in the grounds of a grand stately home, dish out homegrown, organic food under the stars. On the final night, Liz and Stuart host, and Stuart realises that it might be an uphill battle to impress their rivals. None of their guests is aware that Stuart and Liz don't actually live together, but questions are raised when Adeeba and Alison don't find any of Stuart's clothes in the master bedroom, and Omer and Bobby discover Stuart's campervan with a double bed parked outside
S2020E26

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Marbella: TV presenter Kim Woodburn and her husband Pete decide they would like to take ownership of a holiday home on the Costa del Sol, so Jonnie Irwin takes them to view five penthouses that meet their £320,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Fuerteventura: With retirement rapidly approaching, Jan and Phil Jackson wish to relocate to the Canary Island of Fuerteventura, having been inspired by Jan's sister who has already made the move there. Property expert Scarlette Douglas shows them five detached villas within their £215,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
In Portugal, a B&B gets busy after Covid restrictions ease, a family house-hunts in Italy and a couple in France race to finish renovating their holiday lets. Meanwhile, an ambitious trio hope to start a gin distillery in Spain, but get tied up in red tape
S07E34

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 2/5: Solicitor Shoba hosts the second night in north Surrey, and tries to impress with an Indian-themed menu. However, the guests are less than impressed with the food, especially the main course - a curry made from frozen fish - but will a bit of belly dancing, Bollywood-style, help save the day? Meanwhile, singer Petrina and drummer Rob continue their flirting both at and away from the table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 3/5: Drum tutor Rob hosts the third night in north Surrey, hoping his Thai-themed menu will impress his guests, as well as the object of his affections, Petrina. He serves prawns with lemon, lime and chilli for his starter, Thai chicken curry for his main, and rounds off with his own take on an ice-cream sundae. As a single man living in his stepmother's house, Rob thinks his competitors will see him as an underdog, so is intent on pulling out all the stops

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 4/5: Singing teacher Petrina hosts the fourth dinner party in north Surrey, and she believes her experience of entertaining on cruise ships will give her the edge as she plans a showstopper of an evening. However, the diners seem more interested in their host's continued flirting with fellow guest Rob. Will tonight be the night, or will he shy away when he discovers Petrina has sung in the West End and worked with dozens of household names?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 5/5: Giovanni hosts the final night of the competition in north Surrey, intent on flying the flag for Sicily with some family inspired recipes. Even with help from his father, a tagliatelle tragedy leaves him with Parmesan on his face. Becky is less than impressed with Giovanni's dishes, and matters go from bad to worse when he attempts to serve his home-made pasta. However, poor food doesn't deter a romantic Rob from popping the question to Petrina, sending shockwaves across the dining room. In a final attempt to bag the £1,000, Giovanni invites an opera singer to liven up the proceedings, but his musical initiative may prove too little to save the day

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Valencia, Spain: Joe and Kirsty fell in love after meeting at work three years ago. Now they want to swap their house in Hampshire for their perfect home in the warmer climes of inland Valencia, Spain. For her £115,000 budget, Danni tees up five options for Peggy to see along with her mother Coral, but will any score a hole in one?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 1/5: In Guildford, Surrey, the first host is glamorous 22-year-old cosmetic-surgery-fan Shanice, who hopes to show she is more than just a pretty face by serving up sumptuous food and dazzling conversation. The guests she must impress are 32-year-old entertainer David, 69-year-old Norwegian plain-talker Vivi, 47-year-old super-competitive Neil and 25-year-old media sales worker Charlotte. With risky menu choices and a fellow diner's peculiar laughter taking the spotlight, will the conversations ranging from lookalikes to riding polar bears be enough to secure Shanice the prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 2/5: Retired estate agent Vivi hosts the second dinner party in and around Guildford. She is convinced her experience and original Scandinavian fayre can beat her less experienced competition and the soiree features Norwegian fish soup, ghost stories, ghost impressions, Norwegian singing and nursery rhymes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 3/5: Sales manager Charlotte hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in and around Guildford, hoping to impress her guests enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, she has taken a huge risk with an Asian-inspired menu, which could prove to be too exotic for entertainments manager David

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 4/5: The penultimate day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sees children's entertainments manager David playing host. Having worked in the entertainments industry all his life, he is no stranger to showing people a good time, and employs his colleagues to put on a performance, while keeping his food simple. Is he forgetting the key ingredients of a dinner party?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 5/5: On the final day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sales director Neil devises a sophisticated menu, dismissing his predecessors' efforts as unambitious. programme.title: Billionaire Blooms

Cameras delve behind the scenes to observe the work of some of the UK's top florists as they create floral wonderlands for their super-wealthy clients. In this first episode, Jamie is in Italy for his toughest gig yet, the wedding of one of his most treasured clients. A multi-venue event spans four days and the length and breadth of Venice. Jamie needs to transport himself, his team of almost 40 and over 100,000 stems of the best flowers available everywhere by boat, in baking heat. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
Abbey Court Guest House: The first visit of the week is to Abbey Court Guest House in Carlisle. After an afternoon of abseiling, the wastage at breakfast leaves some with a bad taste in their mouths
S2022E61

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
The Lime Tree Inn: The rivals head to the Lime Tree Inn in the Yorkshire village of Great Ouseburn, run by chef Rob and his ex-model wife Heloisa. The guests expect big things from the glamorous couple but things get off to a tricky start when Pav questions the value for money and Kelly gives the bathroom a dusting off
S2022E62

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
Holly Grove Farm: The rivals are glamping at Holly Grove Farm in Staffordshire. Hosts Dave and Karon believe it is a rural idyll and their guests agree - apart from one, who is not happy with their size of their hut
S2022E63

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
Beldon House B&B: Lincolnshire is the last destination of the week, where Pav is on hosting duties at his Beldon House B&B. The grand exterior gets the guests feeling fancy, but dirty discoveries in the rooms leave some feeling 'bugged out'. At least the B&Bers all enjoy a good night's sleep - only to be ruined by instant coffee the following morning
S2022E64

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Fri 21 Oct 2022: Payment Day: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers, before discovering who has won the latest competition. Abbey Court Guest House's Kelly wants to sink her teeth into her breakfast score, while The Lime Tree Inn operators have some qualms about Pav's facilities comments. Pav's under the microscope again for the poor sleep score he gave Holly Grove Farm, before he cleans up everyone's cleanliness concerns

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2019: Gran Alacant, Costa Blanca: Mick and Dianne from Newcastle want to make a permanent move to the sun. Ben Hillman helps them find their perfect place around Gran Alacant on the Costa Blanca, showing them properties within their budget of £120,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: St Lucia: Scarlette Douglas shows North Ayrshire couple Sam and Shirley five properties with incredible views on the Caribbean island of St Lucia for their budget of £400,000. Spoilt with so much choice, do they go for a villa in their favourite location or are they tempted by a property that feels like their very own home back in North Ayrshire?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: New Zealand: Newlyweds Bill Powell and Michael Dolman cannot wait to start a whole new chapter together and move to the other side of the world. Armed with a budget of £345,000, Ben Hillman shows them five very different properties in New Zealand. With so much choice, which will prove to have the biggest wow factor to become their new home in the southern hemisphere?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Valencia, Spain: Joe and Kirsty fell in love after meeting at work three years ago. Now they want to swap their house in Hampshire for their perfect home in the warmer climes of inland Valencia, Spain. With a maximum budget of £280,000, the pair look to property expert Jean Johansson to help them realise their dream

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Villamartin, Costa Blanca: Lee and Louise from Warwickshire are looking for a three-bedroom, two-bathroom detached villa with a private pool in Villamartin on Spain's Costa Blanca, for their budget of £212,000. Leah Charles-King shows them five impressive properties, hoping at least one will be good enough to tempt Lee and Louise to make an offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Queensland: Mel and Steve want to buy a holiday home in south Queensland, Australia that will become their permanent home once they retire. The property also has to suit their daughter Vikki, who has relocated to Oz and plans to move in. It's a big challenge for Ben Hillman as he sets out to find a property that gives Mel, Steve and Vikki everything they want from their wish-list, on their budget of £220,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Dénia: Newlyweds Alison and Gabriel from Greater Manchester have been together for five years and are looking to buy a property together in the town of Dénia on Spain's northern Costa Blanca. Craig Rowe lines up five properties for them to consider, all within their budget of £110,000

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Brilliant Builds: Into the Garden: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows that highlighted the need to get the balance between home and garden just right. In Bury St Edmunds, Lauren Grant believes the opportunity to build on a land she and husband Christian bought from the council will transform their confused downstairs. He, however, just wants rid of the house altogether. Meanwhile, Harrogate couple Carol and Andrew need extra space for Grandad. Can Kirstie build into their sizeable garden or will Phil find somewhere else more suitable?
S01E06

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc:
PC Jack is taken aback when early into the night shift two partygoers ask him if he can help them find their weed, while seasoned cops Matt and Emma reminisce about some of the worst insults they have received. But the night takes a darker turn when Jack is called to help a young woman who has been spiked in a nightclub, and PCs Amelia and Craig attend a mass brawl outside a pub, only to be accused of ruining a suspect's life
S01E07

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc:
Jimmy Carr hosts as Roisin Conaty and Kiri Pritchard-McLean take on Jon Richardson and Rob Beckett. Comedian Hugh Davies is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate
S22E01

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: One-off special of the sitcom, in which Charles prepares to finally ascend to the throne with all the pomp and ceremony he deserves. However, Wills tries to persuade him the ceremony should reflect the frugal times the nation is living through. Meanwhile in California, Harry and Meghan are finally free of Windsor family politics to concentrate on their simple life. But can they really afford to miss the crowning moment?

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:
The hunters use social media in a sneaky bid to trap YouTube star Saffron Barker, so in their attempt to make it all the way to extraction, she and partner Bobby Seagull bare all. Nik and Eva Speakman head to Brighton for some deep cover at the home of former Coronation Street actor Brian Capron. In County Durham, Katya Jones and Aimee Fuller plan a rendezvous with Katya's former Strictly Come Dancing partner Ed Balls
S05E05

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
Old Honkfoot: Greg Davies challenges the short-term memory and musicality of contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin as the five intrepid comedians approach the halfway point in the series. Frankie impresses with his falsetto, while Kiell wows everyone with his spoon retrieval abilities. Plus, Mae fakes their way into assistant Alex Horne's wallet
S15E05

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body
S11E02

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc:
A cheesemaker meets a marketer with an endless line of jokes, and a company director and a fan of motorbikes and rockabilly share their love of the 1950s. Two gym enthusiasts seem to hit it off, but disaster strikes later in the night, while two executives with a taste for sharp suits seem like a good fit
S20E02

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc:
The Seemingly Never-Ending Story: Homer gets trapped in a cave after trying to acquire a piece of stalactite during a family walk, leaving Marge, Maggie and Bart to go in search of help. As they wait, Lisa passes the time by telling her father a long and very strange tale in which she seeks refuge at Mr Burns' mansion
S17E13

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Llanelli 1/5: Council manager Charlotte hosts the first dinner party in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, where she hopes to impress electrician Steve, occupational nurse Christine, retired French teacher Meic, and teaching assistant Ainsley with an evening that features a former rugby choir as entertainment

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In the West Country, three rival couples compete to host the best dinner party. On the first night, handyman Sam and his wife Kate attempt a restaurant quality meal. On night two, proud Somerset pair Colin and Kate host at their family farm and serve pork sourced from Colin's brother's pig farm. On the final night, festival lovers Aron and Kath put on a beach-themed dinner party, and although they are confident about their culinary prowess, disaster strikes on not one, but two courses. The rest of their meal comes together well, but is it enough to bag the cash prize of £1,000?
S2020E30

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Central Algarve: Semi-retired travel rep Nicola Harrison from Dorset has spent a season 22 years ago looking after holiday-makers in the Algarve, and now fancies moving there herself. She enlists the help of Jasmine Harman who looks for properties that will aid Nicola in the next chapter of her life

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Estepona, Costa del Sol: Renuka Joseph is looking for a holiday home where she can entertain family and friends and relax with her husband Clarence. She's originally from Sri Lanka and has chosen the Costa del Sol as her perfect spot because the beaches remind her of home. She's brought her best friend Shanez along to help, so Jasmine Harman shows them five apartments in and around Estepona for her £80,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: St Lucia: Newly engaged couple Natasha and Extus from London have £300,000 to spend on their first home together, on St Lucia. Extus grew up there, and Natasha has been in love with the island ever since holidaying there for the first time 15 years ago. They're looking for a home that can also double up as a luxury B&B. Danni Menzies shows them five properties to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
As the end of the summer approaches, two gite owners in France prepare for their first guests, a business trio embark on a new venture in Spain, and a family-of-five seeks to find its dream home and business in Italy
S07E35

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In Cockermouth, Cumbria, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole meet blacksmith Jon, who spent many years working on fairgrounds. At the valuation, independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan reckons there's rich pickings to be made from railway memorabilia
S05E05

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 1/5: On the first night in Peterborough, 39-year-old land surveyor and part-time musician Muneer hopes to win over his guests with a menu based on Pakistani recipes passed down through his family for generations. The authenticity extends beyond his food, with Muneer seating his guests on the floor of his specially dressed dining room. His guests include driving instructor Christine, hairdresser Ben, fiery Brazilian Rosie and fridge salesman Gregory. While his food receives mixed reviews, His guests discover his master plan for musical success, suffer bad jokes and find out that one of their fellow diners believes in mermaids

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 2/5: In Peterborough, driving instructor Christine hopes her vegetarian cuisine will grab her the £1,000 prize. But she's worried about being in the firing line, after Rosie compared Muneer's food to vomit on the first night. Now Moony's determined to give Rosie a public dressing down. However, with everyone dreading Christine's meat-free and bland-sounding menu, Rosie may not be the only one who has to bite her lip

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 3/5: In Peterborough, mobile hairdresser Ben plans a gourmet night. Most of his guests are looking forward to some meat after Christine's vegetarian feast the night before. And after laid-back Muneer and critical Rosie seem to have put their tension behind them at Christine's, Ben's determined to take things up a notch as he entertains his guests with his amazing body art, cooking skills and pet crabs

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 4/5: Fridge salesman Gregory serves up a Spanish menu in Peterborough, accompanied by a charm offensive that he hopes will win him the £1,000 prize. Will it work or will the guests give him the cold shoulder?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peterborough 5/5: Fiery Brazilian Rosie is confident that her night will be the best of the week in Peterborough. After Gregory used packet mixes, Rosie is determined to show him how to throw a dinner party by making everything from scratch. She's ruffled a few feathers throughout the week with her brutally honest critiques, and her guests, roused for retribution, scour every element of her Brazilian night for any faults, from her samba dancers to her authentic pig-ear stew

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman heads to the inland towns and villages of Almería province in southern Spain to help Candy and Mark find the perfect holiday home before their wedding in six months

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Curious four-month-old terrier puppies Bobo and Lenny start scouting out their new surroundings at the centre. The brother and sister are completely different in looks and personality, but both need a forever home. Meanwhile, the staff bring together 82-year-old Alan and lhasa apso Ruby, both of whom are looking for comfort after losing a loved one
S01E05

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
A delivery driver is the victim of a carjacking and ends up being dragged along the road. On the M40, 13 stowaway migrants are found in a lorry full of tyres and in need of urgent medical care. A man collapses while having a fit in the middle of a busy road, and a woman experiences uncontrollable spasms in her legs at the stress of losing a child
S06E01

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: One-off special following South Yorkshire Police investigating reports of bullying, from playground brawls and racism in schools, to coercive domestic abuse. Cases featured include a 14-year-old boy hospitalised by a gang in the street, a single vulnerable woman being systematically targeted by local teens in her own home, and a distraught mother watching her 27-year-old son attempting suicide after being bullied at work

programme.title: Le Mans '66 (2019)
programme.desc: Racing car driver and engineer Carroll Shelby is lured out of retirement during the 1960s, in a period where the sport is dominated by Italian companies. Ford Motors are hoping to revive their flagging fortunes by launching a racing division and securing a high-profile win at the prestigious Le Mans 24-hour race. Shelby takes up the challenge of headlining the plan to build a revolutionary new race car, but courts conflict within the company by recruiting unpredictable, short-tempered British driver Ken Miles to take the wheel. Fact-based drama, starring Matt Damon, Christian Bale, Jon Bernthal and Caitriona Balfe

programme.title: Andrew: The Problem Prince
programme.desc:
The first of two programmes telling the inside story of Prince Andrew's 2019 Newsnight interview with Emily Maitlis and the subsequent chain of events that led to a royal disaster. In the 1980s, Andrew was a Falklands war hero and a national heart-throb, glory years that culminated in his marriage to Sarah Ferguson. But following his departure from the Navy, his image took a turn as his new role as trade envoy proved unsuccessful - and his need to fund a lavish lifestyle and friendship with Jeffrey Epstein eventually prompted the interview that cemented his downfall
S01E01

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E10

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc:
A nutrition student hoping to meet a man who is open with his feelings finds she is not used to compliments during a date with a football coach, and has to brush up on her flirting. Elsewhere, two diners bond over their shared love of dogs, a farmer presents his date with a gift of beetroot, and a woman discovers she has met her supposedly blind date before
S20E03

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc:
The Rothschild's giraffes are expecting a new addition as 12-year-old matriarch Dagmar, whose last calf died after a few days, goes into labour after a 15-month pregnancy. Orang-utan sisters Tuti and Siska, and their baby cousin Kesuma, rebuild their relationship after the trauma of the fire that engulfed their habitat in December 2018, while the keepers set off in pursuit when a blue-throated macaw goes on the run
S08E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Llanelli 2/5: Electrician Steve hosts the second night of the competition in Llanelli, Carmarthenshire, and hopes that his menu of lasagne, vegetable soup and homemade wine will impress his guests and win him the £1,000 prize. As the evening goes on, Meic decides to bare all with a revelation that shocks Christine

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In Somerset, three rival duos compete to host the best dinner party. Married couple Jacqueline and Stephen host first with their Mediterranean menu. On day two, social media enthusiast Jess and her boyfriend Fred show off their Portuguese cooking. On the last night, Jacqueline, Stephen, Jess and Fred have high expectations for Rob and Simon's culinary skills
S2020E15

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Altea, Costa Blanca: Laura Hamilton helps former firefighter Gary Sheen and his partner Kevin Lambert from Essex find a new home in the Altea region of Spain's Costa Blanca. With a budget of £175,000, the couple are torn between a two-bedroom apartment with jaw-dropping views, or a town house opposite one of their favourite restaurants

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Torrevieja: Dave and Debbie Chambers from Redditch, Worcestershire, started their family young, but now their four children have grown up, they've decided to recapture their youth and buy a place in Spain where they can enjoy time in the sun - just the two of them. For their budget of £45,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five apartments in and around the town of Torrevieja, but will any of them be their perfect place?

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Motorbike fan David is keen to move to Almería, but wife Fiona will take some convincing before she leaves Yorkshire. Pilates fan Esther searches for a holiday home in Alicante
S05E08

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
A derelict building in a French village gets a new lease of life. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple dip their toes into their first season as holiday hosts, and in southern France, a very special event takes place in a refurbished chapel
S01E20

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien continue their mission to repurpose old cast-offs into cash, making an extraordinary find from a Dutch designer in accountant Debbie's lean-to
S05E06

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 1/5: Sports fanatic James Cox hosts the first of the week's dinner parties in Northampton, and he is confident that his French-Italian menu will bag him the £1,000 prize. However, some of his guests - Barb Wiles, Donna Harris, Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash - are left confused by his Vichyssoise soup starter, and the tiramisu causes one of them to choke

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 2/5: Mother-of-three Donna Harris hosts the second dinner party in Northampton, and hopes that three courses of pure comfort-food will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize. Donna spends almost as much time fixing her make-up as she does preparing the meal, and when guests Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash discover a secret stash of football shirts, they realise there is more to their hostess than meets the eye

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 3/5: Part-time actress Caroline Nash is the host on day three of the competition in Northampton, and she hopes that a menu based on her travels will dazzle her guests. However, the night gets off to a shaky start as Donna Harris finds a hair on the side of her goat's cheese salad, while businessman Duncan Fielding seems more interested in goats themselves than the food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 4/5: Party-loving Barb Wiles hosts the fourth dinner party in the Northampton area, and hopes her Australian-themed menu will wow her guests and win her the £1,000 prize. However, the competitors are unnerved by her interest in extraterrestrials while snooping around her bedroom, and things go from bad to worse when a seafood starter and undercooked chicken result in tears at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Northampton 5/5: Attention-loving businessman and keen cricketer Duncan Fielding takes centre stage in hosting the final dinner party from Northampton. He creates a menu based on the story of his life - which is full of surprises and full of spice - but it proves a challenge for three of his guests, who like their food mild. His main feature is a chicken and reindeer curry, and the table is impressed to discover that he runs a community pub from the bottom of his garden

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Peyia, Cyprus: Jasmine Harman travels to Peyia in western Cyprus to help Pauline and Chris find their perfect holiday home on a budget of £80,000

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
The charity version of the popular baking show returns, and with Noel Fielding on paternity leave, Matt Lucas is presenting on his own. In previous editions, comedian Tom Allen has stepped in to co-present - but today he is showing off his baking skills as one of the contestants, alongside Star Wars actress Daisy Ridley, comedian Rob Beckett and singer Alexandra Burke. To impress Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith, the celebrities serve up millionaire shortbread, a fruity tart and their pet hates in cake form in the showstopper
S04E01

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the family room and how best to use the empty space downstairs. They draw inspiration from the Chinese bedroom at Longleat House and the plant-based textiles and natural dyes on display at London Fashion Week. Sarah realises that she can't carry on working in random parts of the house, so comes up with a plan to seamlessly weave her workspace into the living area.

Comedy adventure, starring Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn and Adam Brody

programme.desc:

Could Kirstie persuade them to go with her redesigns or would Phil find either couple a much more suitable new place?

programme.desc: Olympic gold medallist and Christian missionary Eric Liddell returns to China to work as a teacher and gets caught up in the Japanese invasion of 1937. Biopic, starring Joseph Fiennes, Richard Sanderson and Augusta Xu-Holland

programme.desc: An American tourist in Paris falls in love with a French single mother, and hastily marries her before bringing her home with him to Oklahoma. programme.title: The Tourist (2010)
programme.desc: A fugitive's girlfriend is being watched by the police while travelling from Paris to Venice. She seduces an unsuspecting American tourist to make them think he is her lover with his appearance altered by plastic surgery, leaving the baffled holidaymaker pursued across Europe by the cops and rival gangsters. Romantic thriller, with Johnny Depp, Angelina Jolie and Paul Bettany

programme.title: Crowhurst (2017)
programme.desc: An inexperienced sailor enters a race to circumnavigate the globe and decides to cheat to come last, but things do not go to plan. Fact-based drama, starring Justin Salinger

programme.title: Renegades (2017)
programme.desc: Navy Seals discover an underwater treasure in a Bosnian lake. Action adventure, starring JK Simmons, Sullivan Stapleton and Charlie Bewley

programme.title: Angel Heart (1987)
programme.desc: A shady 1950s private eye is hired by a mysterious stranger to find a missing singer with a debt to pay. The detective's search for the musician leads him into dark and disturbing territory, as everybody who helps him meets a grisly fate. However, the truth is far more shocking than he ever expected. Supernatural thriller, starring Mickey Rourke, Robert De Niro, Lisa Bonet and Charlotte Rampling

programme.title: The Spy (2019)
programme.desc: Actress and stage star Sonja Wigert is recruited by Swedish intelligence to spy on Nazi officials during the Second World War. However, the situation is complicated when Nazi officer Josef Terboven makes her spy on the Swedes. Director Jens Jonsson's drama, starring Ingrid Bolso Berdal, Rolf Lassgard and Damien Chapelle. In Norwegian, Swedish and German

programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the controversial social psychology experiments carried out at Yale University by Stanley Milgram in 1961, in which he tested ordinary humans' willingness to obey authority. Peter Sarsgaard and Winona Ryder star

programme.desc: Two London brothers' money worries get out of hand, as loan sharks come after them demanding payment. When their rich but crooked uncle arrives in town, they turn to him for help, only to find he expects them to kill one of his rivals in return. Woody Allen's drama, starring Ewan McGregor, Colin Farrell, Tom Wilkinson and Sally Hawkins

programme.title: Lantana (2001)
programme.desc: The relationships of four couples living in Sydney become entangled after the discovery of an unidentified corpse. Among them is the detective in charge of the case, who is cheating on his wife with a psychiatrist - who in turn has issues about her child, a murder victim, and is also concerned her aloof academic husband might be gay. Drama, starring Geoffrey Rush, Barbara Hershey and Anthony LaPaglia

programme.title: Broken City (2013)
programme.desc: A New York cop is forced to quit the force to avoid a scandal over the shooting of a suspect, and becomes a private eye. Years later, the mayor hires the detective during a re-election campaign to find out if his wife is having an affair - but the investigation uncovers a web of political corruption. Crime thriller, with Mark Wahlberg, Russell Crowe and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Infamous (2020)
programme.desc: Arielle is a social media-obsessed teenager who is saving money because she wants to get out of her small hometown in Florida. She falls in love with Dean, a mechanic who was once involved in an armed robbery. When Arielle realises her money has been stolen, she and Dean set off on a crime spree, uploading footage of their illegal activities for their growing fanbase. Drama, starring Bella Thorne, Jake Manley and Amber Riley
